docs.snippet: Over the weekend, Mr. Buffett urged fellow executives to start worrying about rising health care costs and how they put American businesses at a disadvantage.

headline.print_headline: Health Costs, Not Taxes, Pose Risks, Buffett Says
headline.main: Forget Taxes, Warren Buffett Says. The Real Problem Is Health Care.

docs.snippet: Also, whom to tell first about quitting a job; a good reason for avoiding handshakes; a mother with a grudge tries to ban daughter from seeing aunt.

headline.main: Do You Have to Hang Out With People When Grieving?

docs.snippet: We asked The New York Times audience on Facebook, “What is the future of identity?” Their answers were illustrated by Franziska Barczyk.

headline.print_headline: What Is the Future of Identity?
headline.main: What Is the Future of Identity?

docs.snippet: Trump keeps touting his economic record but recent data show the post-election boomlet is fading.
The F.B.I. director felt uncomfortable and hesitant to confront his boss.

headline.print_headline: Women Say to Comey: Welcome to Our World
headline.main: Women Say to Comey: Welcome to Our World

docs.snippet: Some alterations to the A.C.A. proposed by the Republicans actually make sense, but don’t expect the stalemate to end anytime soon.
The transportation hub serving about 650,000 daily passengers desperately needs an overhaul. So far, the New York governor’s plans don’t begin to address the problems.

headline.main: Cuomo Has the Opportunity to Fix Penn Station, but Will He?

docs.snippet: Also, working while hosting; silence from an ex’s parents; and a missing donation at an 8-year-old’s birthday party.

headline.main: Parents Won’t Pay for Harvard After a Year Off to Help the Poor

docs.snippet: At Crotona Park, a stylish new clubhouse is about more than topspin. It’s the home of a tennis and tutoring program for underserved children.

headline.print_headline: In the Bronx, Tennis for Everyone
headline.main: Tennis, for Anyone? In the Bronx, the Answer Is Yes

docs.snippet: Also, a toddler menace at the playground, and sorting out discretionary spending with one’s spouse.

headline.main: When Is It O.K. to Date a Friend’s Ex?
